tool_description: The Azure Smartable API offers the Microsoft Azure news, learning resources, events, influencers and other information.
name: Azure Smartable
title: Azure Smartable

api_list.name: GetNews
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com/news/page/1/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com/news/page/{page}/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

value.title: General availability: Azure Blob Storage SDK for Go
value.excerpt: The new Azure Blob Storage SDK is now generally available for Go, allowing developers to build Go apps that interact with objects in Azure Blob Storage.

value.title: Public Preview: GraphQL resolvers for Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL in Azure API Management
value.excerpt: We are thrilled to announce the public preview of Azure Cosmos DB and Azure SQL resolvers for GraphQL in Azure API Management.

value.title: Azure DNS is zero-day resilient with a diverse, multi-stack DNS infrastructure platforms.
value.excerpt: The Azure DNS team has expanded its infrastructure to leverage multiple hardware and software stacks for its public DNS platform, including Azure Traffic Manager (ATM) increasing resiliency for zero-day outages.

value.title: Azure HDinsight Spark 2.4 approaching EOL
value.excerpt: Azure HDInsight for Apache Spark 2.4 will be retired as of February 10, 2024.

value.title: Microsoft: Azure Portal outage was caused by traffic “spike”
value.excerpt: Microsoft revealed in an update to the Azure status page that the preliminary root cause behind an outage that impacted the Azure Portal worldwide on Friday was what it described as a traffic "spike."

value.title: Announcing the new Azure Container Registry libraries
value.excerpt: We’re pleased to announce that version 1.1.0 of the Azure Container Registry (ACR) libraries for .NET, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Python are now generally available.

value.title: Microsoft launches GPT-enabled Azure AI for US government agencies
value.excerpt: “Currently, large language models that power generative AI tools live in the commercial cloud. For government customers, Microsoft has developed a new architecture that enables government agencies to securely access the large language models in the ...

value.title: Public preview: Azure Container Instances(ACI) Spot containers
value.excerpt: You can now take advantage of unused Azure computing with Azure Container Instances (ACI)

value.title: Should you migrate from Azure AD Connect to Cloud Sync?
value.excerpt: Cloud Sync will eventually replace Azure AD Connect for using your on-prem Active Directory with the cloud. Here's what you need to know to plan for that.

value.title: Generally available: 8TB memory Mv2 Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: Mv2 8TB Memory virtual machine is generally available now for your in-memory workloads.

value.title: CGI Federal successfully demonstrates Microsoft Azure Orbital Cloud Access and Nokia Private 5G communications to support U.S.
value.excerpt: Bloomberg subscribers can gift up to 5 articles a month for anyone to read, even non-subscribers! Learn more

value.title: GA Azure API Management Self-hosted gateway authentication using Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: New authentication method for the Self-hosted gateway with the configuration endpoint

value.title: Windows 365 Boot: a paid subscription to boot your local PC into your Microsoft cloud PC
value.excerpt: Microsoft is improving its Windows 365 Cloud PC service with Windows 365 Boot, a Windows 11 exclusive feature designed to boot a local machine directly into

value.title: Announcing Azure AI Content Safety
value.excerpt: Azure AI Content Safety is a new Azure AI service that identifies harmful online content, categorizes it, and assigns severity scores, supporting human content moderator workloads.

value.title: Azure Stream Analytics is Launching a New Competitive Pricing Model!
value.excerpt: Up to 80% price reduction in Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Optimize your reservation purchases with reservation utilization alerts.
value.excerpt: Activate reservation utilization alerts and take control of your Azure reservation strategy.

value.title: AMD Confidential VM option for Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Users can now select AMD-based confidential VMs for their Azure Databricks cluster driver node and cluster worker nodes.

value.title: Azure Key Vault Access Configuration Update
value.excerpt: Azure RBAC is now the recommended authorization system for the Azure Key Vault data plane.

value.title: Database Migration Assessment for Oracle - GA
value.excerpt: Database Migration Assessment for Oracle extension analyzes an organization's Oracle database, identifying performance requirements and code compatibility with the target Azure database for a smooth migration.

value.title: Public Preview: Time-travel for Azure Synapse Link for Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Rewind to read previous transactions in Synapse Link containers to analyze previous versions of your document with time-travel for Azure Synapse Link

value.title: General availability: Confidential containers on Azure Container Instances (ACI)
value.excerpt: ACI now lets you run containers in a trusted execution environment (TEE)

value.title: Generally Available: Cost-optimizations with transformations on Log Analytics for troubleshooting Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Optimize costs on your Log Analytics workspace by adding transformation rules to your Cosmos DB LA tables.

value.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor Container insights introduces "Cluster Optimization" workbook
value.excerpt: Customers can now use Azure Monitor Container insights “Cluster Optimization” workbook to optimize container limits and request, identify event anomalies and detect liveness probe failures.

value.title: Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: New features now available in PuPr include the ability to evaluate text/image data fairness and enjoy one platform to build, tune, evaluate, deploy, and test AI workflow with LLM.

value.title: Build next-generation, AI-powered applications on Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt:
Welcome to Microsoft Build 2023—the event where we celebrate the developer community. This year, we’ll dive deep into the latest technologies across application development and AI that are enabling the next wave of innovation.
The post Build next-generation, AI-powered applications on Microsoft Azure

api_list.name: GetNewsByTopic
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com/news/compute/page/1/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

value.title: Generally available: 8TB memory Mv2 Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: Mv2 8TB Memory virtual machine is generally available now for your in-memory workloads.

value.title: Preview: Automatic Scaling for App Service Web Apps
value.excerpt: App Service has an automatic scaling capability that adjusts the number of running instances of your application based on incoming HTTP requests.

value.title: Preparing for future health emergencies with Azure HPC
value.excerpt: COVID-19 has forever changed how nations function in the globally interconnected economy. To this day, it continues to affect and shape how countries respond to health emergencies.

value.title: ISC 2023: Experience the power of HPC in the cloud with Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: The ISC High-Performance Event (ISC), formerly known as International Supercomputing Conference, is one of the most important events in the high-performance computing (HPC) industry, bringing together some of the world's most prominent researchers, developers, vendors, and users to discuss the latest

value.title: New Azure App Service plans fuel greater choice and savings
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce new plans for Microsoft Azure App Service customers with two new offerings in the Premium v3 (Pv3) service tier, and expansion in the Isolated v2 tier, which powers the high-security App Service Environment v3.

value.title: Azure previews powerful and scalable virtual machine series to accelerate generative AI
value.excerpt: In the competitive race for AI innovation, pushing the envelope requires both experience and leadership-class supercomputing scalability. Powerful and massively scalable infrastructure is paramount as the complexity and size of AI models accelerate.

value.title: Scale Azure Firewall SNAT ports with NAT Gateway for large workloads
value.excerpt: When it comes to providing outbound connectivity to the internet from cloud architectures using Azure Firewall, look no further than NAT gateway.

value.title: Voltus and Azure—no power integrity challenge too big to solve
value.excerpt: With Voltus on Azure, semiconductor companies have the ideal solution to verify power integrity for their most complex designs.

value.title: Do more with less using new Azure HX and HBv4 virtual machines for HPC
value.excerpt: The all-new HX-series and HBv4-series VMs are optimized for a variety of HPC workloads such as computational fluid dynamics (CFD), finite element analysis, frontend and backend electronic design automation (EDA), rendering, molecular dynamics, computational geoscience, weather simulation, AI inference,

value.title: Leverage SFTP support for Azure Blob Storage to build a unified data lake
value.excerpt: SFTP support for Azure Blob Storage is a fully managed, highly scalable SFTP service which enables simple, secure, and easy-to-manage file transfers.

value.title: Azure Virtual WAN simplifies networking needs
value.excerpt: Today we are excited to make announcements in multiple areas of Azure Virtual WAN (vWAN), a networking-as-a-service that brings networking, security, and routing functionalities together to provide a single operational interface.

value.title: In development: Larger SKUs for App Service Environment v3
value.excerpt: Using the new Isolated v2 SKUs, you can now run larger and more complex workloads.

value.title: Advancing anomaly detection with AIOps—introducing AiDice
value.excerpt: We introduce AiDice, a novel anomaly detection algorithm developed jointly by Microsoft Research and Microsoft Azure that identifies anomalies in large-scale, multi-dimensional time series data. AiDice captures incidents quickly and provides engineers with important context that helps them diagnose issues

value.title: App Service support for Ruby is ending 12 April 2023
value.excerpt: App Service support for Ruby workloads is ending on 12 April 2023. Migrate Ruby applications to use a custom container.

value.title: Announcing new enhancements for Azure VMware Solution
value.excerpt: When we launched Azure VMware Solution two years ago amid a pandemic, IT agility became a top priority as organizations scrambled to enable remote work and ensure business resilience via cloud solutions. Fast forward to today, and most organizations recognize that by running workloads in the cloud, they

value.title: Choose the right size for your workload with NVads A10 v5 virtual machines, now generally available
value.excerpt: Introducing the general availability of NVads A10 v5 GPU accelerated virtual machines, now available in US South Central, US West2, US West3, Europe West, and Europe North regions. Azure is the first public cloud to offer GPU Partitioning (GPU-P) on NVIDIA GPUs.

value.title: Improve outbound connectivity with Azure Virtual Network NAT
value.excerpt: For many customers, making outbound connections to the internet from their virtual networks is a fundamental requirement of their Azure solution architectures. Luckily, Azure has just the solution for ensuring highly available and secure outbound connectivity to the internet: Virtual Network Network

value.title: Virtual desktop infrastructure security best practices
value.excerpt: One of the most popular options for organizations who want to offer remote work options is virtual desktop infrastructure or VDI. In this blog, get an overview of VDI and learn security best practices.

value.title: Announcing Azure DNS Private Resolver: Now in preview
value.excerpt: Azure Private DNS Resolver enables you to query Azure Private DNS Zones from an on-premises environment and vice versa without deploying virtual machine (VM) based DNS servers.

value.title: Manage Red Hat workloads seamlessly on Azure
value.excerpt: Business is changing, and keeping up with fluctuations in markets and customer demands is not easy. Together, Microsoft and Red Hat offer you the tools to reduce complexity and simplify your environment, innovate faster, deliver high-quality customer experiences, and expand and scale your infrastructure

value.title: Customize your secure VM session experience with native client support on Azure Bastion
value.excerpt: Azure Bastion is a fully managed jumpbox-as-a-service that provides secure and seamless Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and Secure Shell Protocol (SSH) access to your VMs in local or peered virtual networks. With native client support available on the Standard SKU for Azure Bastion, you now unlock customizable

value.title: Public preview: App Service - Configure networking in Azure Portal during app creation
value.excerpt: VNet integration and private endpoints options now configurable when creating a web application.

value.title: Optimize your cloud investment with Azure Reservations
value.excerpt: For cloud workloads with consistent resource usage, you can buy reserved instances at a significant discount and reduce your workload costs by up to 72 percent compared to pay-as-you-go prices. Azure Reservations can be obtained by committing to one-year or three-year plans for virtual machines, Azure

value.title: Accelerate your AI applications with Azure NC A100 v4 virtual machines
value.excerpt: Real-world AI has revolutionized and changed how people live during the past decade, including media and entertainment, healthcare and life science, retail, automotive, finance service, manufacturing, and oil and gas. Speaking to a smart home device, browsing social media with recommended content, or

value.title: Increase remote storage performance with Azure Ebsv5 VMs—now generally available
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite in November 2021, we announced the memory-optimized Ev5 Azure Virtual Machine (VM) series based on the 3rd Gen Intel Xeon Platinum 8370C processor. The Ev5 VMs are designed for memory-intensive business-critical applications, relational database servers, and in-memory data analytics

value.title: Now in preview: Azure Virtual Machines with Ampere Altra Arm-based processors
value.excerpt: The demand for compute capacity to sustain business modernization and digital transformation initiatives continues to grow. Organizations are facing a complex set of challenges as they deploy a broad range of workloads globally, from the edge to the cloud.

value.title: Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) to Azure with Custom IP Prefix
value.excerpt: When planning a potential migration of on-premises infrastructure to Azure, you may want to retain your existing public IP addresses due to your customers' dependencies (for example, firewalls or other IP hardcoding) or to preserve an established IP reputation. Today, we are excited to announce the general

value.title: App Service Environment version 1 and version 2 will be retired on 31 August 2024
value.excerpt: Migrate to App Service Environment version 3 by 31 August 2024.

value.title: Manage port forwarding for backend pool with Azure Load Balancer
value.excerpt: Starting today, Azure Load Balancer enables customers to manage port forwarding for Virtual Machine Scale Sets or a group of virtual machines in a backend pool with a single set-up with minimum management overhead.

value.title: Azure confidential computing with NVIDIA GPUs for trustworthy AI
value.excerpt: Confidential computing technology encrypts data in memory and only processes it once the cloud environment is verified, helping protect data from cloud operators, malicious admins, and privileged software. Today, we are excited to announce the next chapter in a strategic partnership between NVIDIA and

value.title: Azure fundamentals
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of Azure cloud computing.

topItems.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Explore the core concepts and benefits of cloud computing as you learn how to choose a cloud deployment model customized for your organization.

topItems.title: Create an Azure account
topItems.excerpt: Find out how to start using Azure by creating an account where you’ll see services and personal settings for identity, billing, and preferences.

topItems.title: Core Cloud Services - Introduction to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Create your first virtual machine as you discover the power of Azure cloud computing and storage, along with services that help you explore new software paradigms.

value.title: Describe Azure storage services
value.excerpt: Azure storage services, tiers, redundancy options, and migration options and tools.

value.title: Prepare for cloud security by using the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: Security is a core consideration for all customers, in every environment. But moving to the cloud is a significant change that requires a shift in your security mindset and approach. The Cloud Adoption Framework provides guidance for this security journey by providing clarity for the processes, best practices, models, and experiences.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports cloud adoption as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: The cloud fundamentally changes everything. Traditionally, ownership and responsibility for all aspects of the technology you use, from infrastructure to software, has fallen to enterprises. When you move to the cloud, you can instead provision and consume just the resources you need, when you need them. Although the cloud offers tremendous flexibility, to get the most benefit out of your move to the cloud, you need a proven and consistent methodology for adopting cloud technologies. The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure meets that need, helping guide decisions throughout cloud adoption. This learning path provides an overview of the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure and how to use it as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to update plans for federal network infrastructure, including adoption of cloud technology, and report those plans to OMB/NSC, per Section 3 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **July 11, 2021**.

topItems.title: Getting started with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use the Cloud Adoption Framework getting-started guides to unblock your organization's cloud adoption efforts.

topItems.title: Build a cloud governance strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy. Prepare for AZ-900.

value.title: Azure for Researchers part 1: Introduction to Cloud Computing
value.excerpt: When you're working on research projects, it is helpful to have a basic understanding of cloud computing concepts. In this learning path, you'll study the general terminology and services that of cloud computing, which should be useful to you when you're working on research tasks. You'll learn how to create virtual machine and how to use it, and how to pick the best storage solution to persist your data.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure Azure DNS including custom domain names and record sets.

topItems.excerpt: You will learn to configure a VNet peering connection and address transit and connectivity concerns.

topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

topItems.excerpt: Use Docker to build, store, and manage private container images with the Azure Container Registry.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run and troubleshoot containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances.

value.title: AZ-104: Monitor and back up Azure resources
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and back up Azure resources and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure file and folder backups
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure backup and restore policies that meet your company's regulatory needs.

topItems.title: Configure virtual machine backups
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure virtual machine backups including restore operations.

topItems.title: Configure Azure Monitor
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure Azure Monitor including querying the activity log.

topItems.title: Configure Azure alerts
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure Azure alerts including action groups.

value.title: Create cloud native apps with Azure and open-source software
value.excerpt: Cloud-native apps represent a modern approach to app development, where software systems are designed with cloud scale and capabilities in mind. Cloud-native apps build on open source technologies where feasible, with a focus on architectural modularity.

topItems.title: Introduction to cloud-native apps on Azure
topItems.excerpt: This module teaches concepts and ideas associated with cloud-native apps. We cover selecting Open-Source Software (OSS) components like Kubernetes and PostgreSQL, as well as unique Azure tools like Cosmos DB. We’ll also identify situations that call for building cloud-native apps, and review selecting components in an example scenario.

topItems.title: Orchestrate containers for cloud-native apps with AKS
topItems.excerpt: Cloud-native applications are modular in nature, with components separated and self-contained. Components can be encapsulated in containers, such as those created with Docker, or published from an Azure service. Dynamic scaling can then be managed by Kubernetes. We'll learn to decide when Kubernetes is right for our cloud-native app, and we'll see how to use it as a first building block of our cloud-native architecture.

topItems.title: Build a basic cloud-native service using PostgreSQL and Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Build a basic service consisting of an Express.js-based web service with Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL providing its persistent data store, and managed by a front-end Next.js management web app.

topItems.title: Stream internet-of-things (IoT) data to a cloud-native app with IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: Describes how Azure IoT Central facilitates the design, testing, and implementation of distributed applications that process IoT telemetry data generated by smart devices. When designing cloud-native applications, you can leverage Azure IoT Central to deliver a comprehensive set of features that help with design, testing, and implementation of distributed applications that rely on IoT telemetry.

api_list.name: GetPeople
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com/people/page/1/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

value.excerpt: On day three we will have an additional three sessions covering how you can bring innovation anywhere to your on-prem, multi-cloud and edge environments to efficiently govern, manage, and secure your entire IT estate.
value.name: Webinar miniseries: 8 Ways to Optimize Costs and Maximize Value with Azure IaaS

value.title: Azure webinar series: Migrate Your Datacenter with Azure Migrate
value.excerpt: Join this webinar to learn how to use Azure Migrate to effectively migrate your infrastructure, applications, and data to the cloud.
value.name: Azure webinar series: Migrate Your Datacenter with Azure Migrate

value.title: Virtual Machines Live Demo and Q&A
value.excerpt: Virtual Machines Live Demo and Q&A
value.name: Virtual Machines Live Demo and Q&A

value.title: Microsoft Azure Virtual Training Day: Migrating Server Infrastructure
value.excerpt: เรียนรู้วิธีการอัปเดต infrastructure server แบบ on-premises เพื่อให้องค์กรพร้อมที่จะเริ่มต้นการใช้งานคลาวด์ผ่านการใช้ Hybrid technologies และการ migration workload ต่างๆ  และเรียนรู้เรื่องราวของ Tailwind Traders ซึ่งมีการปรับใช้โดเมนโฮสติ้ง Windows Server 2008 R2 และ Network infrastructure services,
value.name: Microsoft Azure Virtual Training Day: Migrating Server Infrastructure

value.title: The commercial marketplace Updates - October
value.excerpt: Join the commercial marketplace product team for an overview of recently released functionality, roadmap plans, and new resources to facilitate business growth and success selling through and with Microsoft. Hosted by the commercial marketplace release and delivery team, this series features presentations
value.name: The commercial marketplace Updates - October

value.title: Azure webinar series: Azure Synapse Analytics: How It Works
value.excerpt: Join us for this webinar to hear directly from customers using the newest Azure Synapse Analytics features.
value.name: Azure webinar series: Azure Synapse Analytics: How It Works

value.title: Continuous integration using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn to use GitHub Actions with Azure for your DevOps process.
value.name: Continuous integration using GitHub Actions

value.title: Azure webinar series: Learn Best Practices for Enterprise-Wide DevOps Adoption
value.excerpt: Learn how to scale your DevOps practices to improve business metrics, customer satisfaction, and Developer Velocity—creating the right environment for developers to innovate.
value.name: Azure webinar series: Learn Best Practices for Enterprise-Wide DevOps Adoption

value.title: Optimize Remote Manufacturing Data: Ensure Process Quality with Digital Twin
value.excerpt: Join Microsoft and IntraStage as they showcase customer, TrellisWare Technologies, to discuss how they and other complex electronics manufacturers use IntraStage to transform their remote manufacturing with BlackBelt Fusion.
value.name: Optimize Remote Manufacturing Data: Ensure Process Quality with Digital Twin

value.title: Webinar miniseries: 8 Ways to Optimize Costs and Maximize Value with Azure IaaS
value.excerpt: On day two we will have three sessions providing guidance and best practices to accelerate migration of your Microsoft and Linux workloads, and mission critical SAP apps, to Azure. We will also share various ways to optimize the cost of your Azure workloads.
value.name: Webinar miniseries: 8 Ways to Optimize Costs and Maximize Value with Azure IaaS

value.title: Fast Forward Your Operational Transformation Via Microsoft Marketplace
value.excerpt: TwinThread’s platform of predictive operations applications is now available through Microsoft’s value-rich Marketplace environment. Our predictive platform was purpose-built specifically to speed valuable insights into the hands of your industrial manufacturing experts through an easy-to-use system,
value.name: Fast Forward Your Operational Transformation Via Microsoft Marketplace

value.title: Developing for commercial marketplace - October 8th
value.excerpt: Are you looking to publish your solution on the Microsoft Commercial Marketplace?  Join the Microsoft Industry Experiences Architect team to discuss what is new in the Commercial Marketplace, deep dives on a rotating list of developer topics, and live Q&A to help you get your solution published.
value.name: Developing for commercial marketplace - October 8th

value.title: Azure webinar series: Windows Virtual Desktop Deployment Recommendations and Best Practices
value.excerpt: Join this webinar to hear from IT experts about recommendations and best practices to help you prepare for a successful Windows Virtual Desktop deployment.
value.name: Azure webinar series: Windows Virtual Desktop Deployment Recommendations and Best Practices

value.title: Digital Factory: Rapidly Increasing Throughput, Productivity and Competitiveness for Manufacturers
value.excerpt: Join us at this upcoming webinar featuring Evren Ozkaya, Ph.D., Founder and CEO of Supply Chain Wizard, to learn about various digital factory transformation case studies, success and failure stories, and practical use cases.
value.name: Digital Factory: Rapidly Increasing Throughput, Productivity and Competitiveness for Manufacturers

value.title: Exploring Microsoft Azure Infrastructure & Introducing Virtual Machines
value.excerpt:
Catch the Azure cloud computing wave!

Microsoft Azure has taken off over the last several years because of its scalability, efficiencies, reduced costs, and security solutions for your business. Join this session to map out unique ways to modernize your applications and IT infrastructure.
value.name: Exploring Microsoft Azure Infrastructure & Introducing Virtual Machines

value.title: Fall Insurance Partner Showcase
value.excerpt: Insurance businesses, from carrier to broker, are under increasing pressure from new ways of thinking and disruptive competitors in an increasingly uncertain and volatile time. They need to find new ways of working and to accommodate new challenges.  The next wave of changes promises increasingly complex
value.name: Fall Insurance Partner Showcase

value.excerpt: Microsoft Azure has taken off over the last several years because of its scalability, efficiencies, reduced costs, and security solutions for your business. Join this session to map out unique ways to modernize your applications and IT infrastructure.

value.title: Webinar miniseries: 8 Ways to Optimize Costs and Maximize Value with Azure IaaS
value.excerpt: On day one there will be two sessions focusing on how to take advantage of cloud-based solutions to empower remote productivity, and enable business continuity and disaster recovery.
value.name: Webinar miniseries: 8 Ways to Optimize Costs and Maximize Value with Azure IaaS

value.title: The commercial marketplace opportunity - October 6th
value.excerpt: The Microsoft commercial marketplace enables partners around the world to accelerate their growth by providing access to over 4 million monthly users, joint go-to-market benefits, and resources across the broader partner ecosystem. These office hours will help you take advantage of the rapidly changing
value.name: The commercial marketplace opportunity - October 6th

api_list.name: GetTopics
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com/topics/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "azure-smartable.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
